resources.string: Minimal signal strength of the Home network that triggers reconnection
Interval between checking available networks, searching for the chosen one
Vibration notification when reconnects to your Home network

WiFi Prioritizer builds a layer of prioritizing your Wi-Fi networks on top of Android built-in Wi-Fi Manager.\nWiFi Prioritizer will keep an eye on available networks around your device and as soon as your home network is available and strong enough, it’ll reconnect to it.
For the functionality to work you need to do only two simple things:\n a) Set your chosen Home network in Settings (see below)\n b) Start background service using Menu option \"Start Service\".

Home Wi-Fi network - Network of your choice. It’s probably your home network that you’d like to be connected most often.\nNotice that it has to one of the networks configured as remembered in your Android Wi-Fi Settings.

Minimal Wi-Fi Signal strength – minimal signal strength of your Home network that triggers reconnection.\nChoosing Weak signal will reconnect device as soon as Home network is available. Notice that if you reconnect too soon you can lose connection and Android default behavior will again connect you to the strongest remembered network available.\nChoosing Strong signal will reconnect device only when you’ll be close enough to your Home router.

Wi-Fi check interval – how often WiFi Prioritizer will check available networks, searching for your Home network.
Choosing short interval will make your chosen network available sooner but it’ll drain your battery faster.
Choosing too long interval will, on the contrary, make your battery live longer but probably won’t satisfy your requirements of this app.
Choosing 1 – 5 minutes is optimal for me.
Notification on reconnect – vibration notification when WiFi Prioritizer reconnects to your Home network.
Home Widget available with WiFi Prioritizer is a simple informational widget, that shows you the name of your Home network and currently connected network.
